meta_description: The Art Gallery of Alberta is more than just a gallery; it’s a place for everyone to discover, connect, and be inspired. We invite you to explore the world of art with us through exhibitions, events, and programs designed to stimulate conversation and enrich the cultural fabric of Edmonton and beyond.
hours_text:
## Host a party that will be remembered...

**Book your event at the AGA and people will talk about it for years.**

With a stunning structure complete with the swirling of zinc, glass and steel, the Art Gallery of Alberta (AGA) offers unique and unforgettable experiences unlike any other venue. Whether you are planning a wedding reception, a corporate meeting or a networking event, the AGA offers numerous options for groups large and small. 

**The AGA is a stunning venue for celebrations and events.**

With its soaring spaces, state–of-the-art features and remarkable exhibitions, the AGA is an exceptional venue for your next private function. Our event spaces include: 

  * The atrium and main hall that feature soaring high ceilings, natural light and full audio-visual capabilities
  * The Borealis Room and Allan E. Scott Boardroom that are equipped with audio and visual support
  * The 150-seat theatre that is equipped with audio and visual support 
  * The theatre lobby for added space and flexibility 
  * The City of Edmonton Terrace that enhances your guests’ outdoor experience
  * Mouthwatering catering provided by the Edmonton Convention Centre—an award-winning culinary team led by Executive Chef Serge Belair 

_Did you know, you can also book gallery access or_[ _private tours_](https://www.youraga.ca/programs-and-events/exhibition-tours/private-tours) _of our exhibitions to enhance your guests’ experience?_

## Contact

accessibility_text:
The AGA strives to create a welcoming and accessible experience for everyone. We are committed to upholding the principles of independence and inclusion. Please see our full [Accessibility Commitment.](/public/download/files/250552)

The AGA is accessible by many forms of transportation. To learn more about how to get to the AGA, please see [Getting Here](https://www.youraga.ca/visit/getting-here). Please see information about our [hours and admissions](/visit/hours-and-admissions) as well.

**Construction update:** Underground pedway construction may impact your access to the AGA - please see [Getting Here](https://www.youraga.ca/visit/getting-here) for more information.

**  
Note:** Due to safety concerns, the AGA LRT pedway is closed. After getting off the LRT at the Churchill Square station, please follow the signs to:

  1. The City Hall Pedway and access to the ground level, (we are right across the street), or

  2. The Churchill Connector on the southeast corner of Churchill Square, directly across the Winspear. It has escalators and elevators. The AGA is just across the northeast corner of Churchill Square.

For increased accessibility, the AGA's main entrance has a ramp. The AGA is also wheelchair and stroller-friendly, and companion aids are always free. Complimentary wheelchairs, folding stools and ear plugs are available on request at Guest Services.

View the [map of the AGA](/public/download/files/250550).
